revised_title: G-Protein Regulation of Phosphoinositidase C in Turkey Erythrocyte Membranes
tldr: The article describes the regulation of phosphoinositidase C (PIC) activity in turkey erythrocyte membranes by guanine nucleotides, suggesting the involvement of a G-protein. The study provides insights into the molecular and mechanistic details of PIC regulation and its coupling to phosphoinositidase C activity. This model system offers valuable information on the substrate specificity of PIC and its mode of regulation by hormones.
